course_title: Topics in Contemporary Drama: New and Reimagined Drama
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 9 / Seats Avail: 7Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as THEA 366W)
In this course, we will encounter recent drama of many kinds and will investigate the ways that various theatrical companies introduce new plays to their audiences.  Some of these plays, such as Pulitzer-Prize winning Fat Ham (which will be at the Alliance this Spring), draw from classic texts (Hamlet in this case). Others, possibly including those from EmoryÂ¿s Brave New Works Festival this Spring, present new stories and perspectives on contemporary issues.  Students will have the opportunity to explore authors from diverse backgrounds and will be encouraged to consider how theatrical repertoire have shifted since the pandemic.
course_description: Selected works of the contemporary theater since 1950, including dramatists such as Beckett, Bond, Fornes, Gems, Pinter, Shepard, and Wilson.
sections: Class Nbr: 2625, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 1-2:15p, Instructor: S. Cavanagh, Status: Open
